Selection Controls

Selection controls allow users to choose from predefined options. Vista provides checkbox, toggle, and radio components for different selection scenarios.

Checkbox

Checkboxes represent boolean on/off states.

Basic Checkbox

` import 'vista!

accepted: false

view [ checkbox accepted "I accept the terms"

button "Submit" [ if accepted [ print "Proceeding..." ] ] ] `

Checkbox with Block Label

Use block labels for rich content:

checkbox accepted [ text "I agree to the " label .style:"text-decoration:underline" "terms and conditions" ]

Multiple Checkboxes

` options: #[ news: false updates: true offers: false ]

view [ checkbox options\news "Subscribe to newsletter" checkbox options\updates "Get product updates" checkbox options\offers "Receive special offers" ] `

Toggle

Toggles are stylized checkboxes for on/off settings.

Basic Toggle

` darkMode: false

view [ toggle darkMode "Dark Mode"

button "Apply" [ if darkMode [ enableDarkTheme ] ] ] `

Toggles for Settings

` settings: #[ notifications: true autoSave: false compactView: true ]

view [ toggle settings\notifications "Enable notifications" toggle settings\autoSave "Auto-save changes" toggle settings\compactView "Compact view mode" ] `

Toggle with on-change

Respond to toggle changes:

` enabled: false

view [ toggle enabled "Feature Enabled" .on-change:[ if enabled [ activateFeature ] [ deactivateFeature ] ] ] `

Radio

Radio buttons allow selecting one option from a group.

Basic Radio Group

` color: "red"

view [ label "Choose color:" radio color ["red" "green" "blue"] ] `

Radio with on-change

Respond to selection changes:

` size: "medium"

view [ radio size ["small" "medium" "large"] .on-change:[ print ["Selected: " size] updatePreview ] ] `

Radio with Value-Label Pairs

` priority: 1

view [ radio priority [ [1 "Low"] [2 "Medium"] [3 "High"] ] ] `

Block Labels for Radio

Rich content in radio labels:

` color: "red"

radio color [ ["red" [ text "● " label .style:"color:red" "Red" ]] ["blue" [ text "● " label .style:"color:blue" "Blue" ]] ] `

Radio with Option Attributes

Disable individual options:

` choice: "a"

radio choice [ ["a" "Option A" #[]] ["b" "Option B" #[disabled: true]] ; Disabled ["c" "Option C" #[]] ] `

Selection Controls Comparison

Component Use Case State Type

checkbox Boolean on/off Boolean

toggle Settings on/off Boolean

radio One of many String/Number

Complete Example

` import 'vista!

formData: #[ newsletter: false notifications: true theme: "light" ]

view [ text "Preferences" box [ checkbox formData\newsletter "Subscribe to newsletter" toggle formData\notifications "Push notifications" ]

text "Theme" radio formData\theme ["light" "dark" "system"]

button "Save" [ savePreferences ] ] `

Best Practices

  • Use checkbox for independent boolean choices

  • Use toggle for settings and preferences

  • Use radio for mutually exclusive options

  • Provide clear labels for all selection controls

  • Use on-change for immediate feedback
